description.heading: INDUSTRIAL APPLICABILITY
description.p: In the above description, the description has been for where the damping target is an automobile body. However, the damping target device of the present invention does not always have to be an automobile body, and it may be an autonomous traveling carrier, a robot arm, and so forth.

claim.claim-text: 1. A damping apparatus that comprises an actuator that drives an auxiliary mass held by spring elements, with respect to a damping target section, and that suppresses vibrations of the damping target section by using a reaction force at the time of driving the auxiliary mass, the damping apparatus further comprising a resonance suppression section of the actuator based on an ideal actuator inverse characteristic that uses a transfer function of a vibration velocity with respect to an excitation force of a vibrating system of the actuator.
2. The damping apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the transfer function is a secondary vibrating system transfer function of relative vibration velocity with respect to excitation force.
3. The damping apparatus according to claim 2, wherein a damping coefficient of the transfer function is within a range of 1/100 to 100 times a critical damping.

4. The damping apparatus according to claim 1 further comprising a band-pass filter that limits the ideal actuator inverse characteristic to a band in a vicinity of a resonance frequency of the actuator.
5. The damping apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the vibration velocity is calculated from a current and an applied voltage of the actuator.
6. The damping apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the vibration velocity is calculated from a current signal flowing through the actuator, and a voltage command value to the actuator.

7. The damping apparatus according to claim 1 further comprising a vibration suppression command generating section that generates a vibration suppression command value for suppressing vibrations of the damping target section.

8. The damping apparatus according to claim 7, wherein the vibration suppression command value is generated based on an excitation force of an excitation source or frequency information of an excitation force.

9. The damping apparatus according to claim 7, wherein the vibration suppression command value is generated based on an excitation force of an excitation source or frequency information of an excitation force, and a vibration signal of a vibration observation point.
10. The damping apparatus according to claim 7, wherein the vibration suppression command value is generated from vibration information of the damping target section.

11. The damping apparatus according to claim 7, wherein the vibration suppression command value is generated from vibration information of the damping target section, and a vibration signal of a vibration observation point.
12. The damping apparatus according to claim 7, wherein the vibration suppression command value is generated from excitation force information of the damping target section.

13. The damping apparatus according to claim 7, wherein the vibration suppression command value is generated from excitation force information of the damping target section, and a vibration signal of a vibration observation point.
14. The damping apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the actuator is an electromagnetic linear actuator that generates a thrust by an electromagnetic force.
15. The damping apparatus according to claim 14, wherein the electromagnetic linear actuator is a reciprocating motor.
16. The damping apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the actuator is a piezoelectric linear actuator that uses an element that causes displacement by applying a voltage thereto.

17. A damping method for a damping apparatus that comprises an actuator that drives an auxiliary mass held by spring elements, with respect to a damping target section, and that suppresses vibrations of the damping target section by using a reaction force at the time of driving the auxiliary mass, the damping method comprises a resonance suppression step of the actuator based on an ideal actuator inverse characteristic that uses a transfer function of a vibration velocity with respect to an excitation force of a vibrating system of the actuator.
